pr_title: HIVE-23026: Allow for custom YARN application name for TEZ queries (branch-2)

timeline.message:
Support for setup tez job name

add a configuration item 'tez.job.name'  to set tez job name
support for set the tez job name

timeline.bodyText: The second value here, I believe is a 'default' value. The default should be HIVE-%s. Also please update comments to explain how this works.
timeline.author: belugabehr
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1500,6 +1500,9 @@ private static void populateLlapDaemonVarsSet(Set<String> llapDaemonVarsSetLocal
     HIVEQUERYNAME ("hive.query.name", null,
         "This named is used by Tez to set the dag name. This name in turn will appear on \n" +
         "the Tez UI representing the work that was done."),
+    HIVETEZJOBNAME("tez.job.name", null,

replies.bodyText: We can use 'set tez.job.name=<customized_job_name>;' or '--hiveconf ez.job.name=<customized_job_name>'  to use this function to customize Yarn application name when we run a sql
replies.author: xiejiajun

timeline.author: belugabehr

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the hint, I have updated the code according to your suggestion
replies.author: xiejiajun

timeline.message: update tez job name default scheme

timeline.bodyText:
Still need to update this comment.  Something like:
The job name may be a Java String.format() String, to which a the session ID will be supplied as the single parameter.
timeline.author: belugabehr
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1500,6 +1500,9 @@ private static void populateLlapDaemonVarsSet(Set<String> llapDaemonVarsSetLocal
     HIVEQUERYNAME ("hive.query.name", null,
         "This named is used by Tez to set the dag name. This name in turn will appear on \n" +
         "the Tez UI representing the work that was done."),
+    HIVETEZJOBNAME("tez.job.name", "HIVE-%s",
+        "This named is used by Tez to set the job name. This name in turn will appear on \n" +
+        "the Yarn UI representing the Yarn Application Name."),

replies.bodyText:
@belugabehr
ok. I have updated the comment
replies.author: xiejiajun
